review_text: Comfortable quiet stay in a pet friendly place. Very attentive host and a clean and comfortable space. Huge bathroom and living area but very small place for food preparation. Prepare to eat out. An easy drive to downtown shops and restaurants.
What a wonderful stay- lovely people and lovely animals… thank you Colleen!
We had a wonderful time staying here! The host was friendly and very accommodating for us and our two dogs. The place was clean and our hosts made us feel right at home!
What an amazing stay! Colleen was so accommodating and friendly - will definitely be rebooking if available in the future!

One of the best farm stays I’ve ever had! Colleen knew I was here for work so unfortunately I didn’t have much time to check out the grounds but I’m sure they’re great. She was very respectful of my anxious dog and she was easy to communicate with. The place inside was spotless which is rare for a barn farm stay. Everything was cozy, thoughtful, intentional, and I felt right at home. Great place to get some studying in, some nice night breezes, and ample room for my dog to enjoy himself inside and outside. I definitely need to return when I’m not on business. Thanks Colleen!

This is the second time we've stayed at Colleen's barn. It's a beautiful spot with a view of the Blue Mountains and easy access to downtown Walla Walla by car. Colleen and her husband, Vern, gave us the royal treatment, especially our son who was celebrating his 6th birthday! He loved interacting with their chickens and goats and meeting one of their dogs, Gringo. The barn is comfy and cozy! We would definitely come again!

This place was amazing. Great hosts! Fun place. If we ever go back, this will be where we will stay. You are just the right amount of distance from downtown and the outskirts of other wineries. They have animals that are fun to pet and look at and great individuals. Super attentive and friendly. We enjoyed our stay!
Very cozy place. Excellent for traveling with pets and lots of thoughtful touches.
Colleen’s place is beautiful! Just what we needed for our road trip.

The location is great: got the farm feel but just 15 mins drive to center of town and great restaurants. Place is warm and spacious. Colleen n Vern are very welcoming hosts. The animals are lovely: feeding them was fun. We had a great stays. Thank you Colleen n Vern.
I took my 9 YO and she absolutely loved it. Colleen and her husband were so hospitable and showed my daughter all their animals. The place is clean and peaceful and well located

We had a delightful stay at Colleen and Vern’s barn. The cozy furnishings immediately made us feel at home, and every need was thoughtfully taken care of, showcasing Colleen’s kindness and Vern’s craftsmanship.
Despite our last-minute request to use the BBQ stove, it was already prepared upon our arrival, which was a lovely surprise.
I spent time with Colleen was filled with laughter and closeness, and we’re grateful to her for providing us with such a peaceful retreat. We look forward to returning!

Colleen and Verne are the essence of Airbnb. They are kind and hospitable. They are really easy to talk to and are genuinely interested in their guests. They are caring and humorous people. We had a great time staying with them. Our toddler loved feeding the animals and doing simple farm routines such as collecting eggs. Colleen and Verne are very patient with us and included us in a lot of activities. Colleen gave the best recommendations to local restaurants. Verne lets us drive his tractor. Our chocolate lab had loads of fun, too! We learned lots of fun facts about farm animals. It was one of the most relaxing vacation break for us! We hope to come back!

Colleen and Vern were amazing! They were so friendly and welcoming and made sure we had everything for our stay. The property was beautiful and the goats and chickens were so fun to feed! Would definitely come back to explore more of Walla Walla!
A quiet and beautiful location near vineyards and farms! The hosts are great too!
It was very cozy!
Very sweet, clean, and comfortable spot. Perfect for traveling with our dog, with the door that opens to the grassy fenced-in area. Colleen was awesome - super friendly and helpful.

We al(and our dog) loved staying here! Really cool Airbnb that's only 5-10 minutes away from downtown Walla Walla and very close to all the Wineries. The farm was so fun - seeing goats, chickens, and horses everyday was the highlight of our dog's trip! And feeding them all marshmallows was an unexpected laugh. The hosts are very responsive and kind, even brought us cupcakes for my 33rd birthday! We would definitely stay again.
Very friendly. Quite. Nice fenced yard for the pooch.

Colleen and her husband were so kind and friendly and for us great company. They were so thoughtful of creating a fun environment for our kids to enjoy the animals and property. Such a beautiful peace of serenity and the Airbnb itself was so clean and well laid out, everything you need was there. Warm at night, plenty of places to sit and relax, overall just a great family experience:-)
My kids absolutely love it here and the host were patient with the kids and their extensive energy and eagerness!

We had a great time relaxing at the Quiet Barn, visiting the animals, and jumping off to visit other parts of Walla Walla and the area. My dogs had a good time and enjoyed the fenced in yard where they could let off steam. It’s clear there is so much thought and care that Colleen put into the space - cute details everywhere. I definitely recommend staying here.

This is the cutest place. We brought our 2 dogs and felt right at home. We were able to charge our car, we just needed to bring our charger.
Colleen and her husband were so friendly and welcoming. We got to play with their dogs, horses and goats. It’s less than 10 mins to downtown and such a great space. We will definitely come back when we can sneak away for the weekend.

Colleen and her husband were wonderful hosts. The space was very clean, cozy and comfortable and we loved that it was pet-friendly for our two pups. Their space is catered to animal lovers, including an open invitation to visit their farm animals which we enjoyed immensely. It was the perfect place to land after a long day of playing in the area. Thank you Colleen!
Second time we've stayed here, highly recommended!

We will definitely stay here again. Very dog friendly, yet extremely clean unlike some other dog-friendly stays. Very comfortable bed. Close to lots of our favorite wineries! We loved feeding the goats, chickens and horses!
What a true gem of a place! Very peaceful and exactly as described and depicted. Colleen was super friendly and responsive. Loved meeting the farm animals. The yard for our dog was perfect!

We all loved our stay! It was the perfect place to come back to and felt like home...clean, comfortable, everything we needed, and such a fun setup inside and out. The animals were one of the highlights of our trip and we really enjoyed our conversations. I'm missing the bed and especially the velvet comforter and have been looking online to order one back home!!

It was not just a comfortable experience but a fun experience! We and the dog enjoyed all the animals including Colleen’s two dogs. The location is perfect! Easy drive into town, quiet (really quiet). Our hosts were very gracious, attentive, friendly, knowledgeable about the area and great company! We hope to see them again! Thanks, Colleen and Vern!

Our favorite Airbnb experience ever! We didn’t want to leave. The space is so comfortable and well furnished. One of the most comfortable beds we’ve ever slept in! Our dogs had the time of their lives and we loved spending time with the animals on the farm. Colleen and her husband are so kind and we had a lovely time talking with them. We will be back again and again! Wish we could have stayed longer!

Colleen and Vern were very responsive. They had great recommendations for food and wineries in the area. The farm was really cute and we loved the friendly animals. The barn room was very well done, modern and cozy. The space was really roomy for just the two of us and the bed was very comfortable. All the linens & towels were plush. Colleen & Vern went out of their way to make us comfortable and accommodate our needs. Would absolutely love to stay here again!
Perfect! A lovely spot, pristine and super comfortable. Colleen and her husband made us feel very welcome. We enjoyed the animals and lovely outdoor patio. A very, very nice stay!
Colleen and Vern were very friendly and made us and our dog feel welcome.
The animals and hosts are both really great.
Colleen and her husband were absolutely lovely hosts, and my kids had a wonderful time feeding the horses and the goats. A perfect stop on a long drive across a few states!
We LOVED this place. The hosts are so sweet and welcoming. I'm a big clean freak and the place was immaculate. Loved the animals, loved the space, loved the location. Don't hesitate to book.

Colleen’s place was the perfect little getaway from the city! We loved the animals and felt so welcome staying there. The bed was the most comfortable Airbnb bed I’ve ever stayed in! Can’t wait to head there again and feed the goats, chickens and horses!
Great hosts, fantastic with our children.
Nice quiet area, beautiful surroundings, Colleen and Vern were very friendly and enjoyed their animals

This was the best Airbnb we have ever stayed at! It felt just like home. It had all of the amenities you would ever need including the ability to pet goats and horses. Colleen was a wonderful host! If you need a place to stay in Walla Walla, look no further.
We loved staying at Colleen's. It was fun to feed the chicken, goats, and horses, and we enjoyed sitting outside and talking with the hosts. Great peaceful location but still close to town.

I wanted a place where my 7 year old daughter could have fun and feel at home. we were traveling with many hours on the road and knowing that the animals were there and a comfortable stay made her extra happy. This little barn has a great theme inside and out. Lots of access to wineries and relaxation right on the patio.
We so very much enjoyed our stay. Tranquil, peaceful, and very comfortable. We will definitely reach out to Colleen again when in the Walla Walla area. Highly recommend!
Had a wonderful time there. Very close to downtown and local vineyards. Spending time on the farm and with the animals was a real treat. Very nice set up for our dogs. Would stay there again

Colleen and Vern are wonderful hosts! Our daughter loved helping brush the goats and horses, and feed everyone their favorite treats: marshmallows! The suite is spacious for a small family, with a compact kitchenette area that provides enough space for all the necessities: coffee, mini fridge, small sink, microwave. comfortable king bed, a comfy futon, great shower/ water pressure - and the setting cannot be beat - immediately accessible to the best of town and country, remote enough for quiet nights and relaxing sunsets. Highly recommended for a welcoming retreat!

Colleen and Vern are wonderful hosts. Their apartment is so cute! It's clean and looks just like the pictures. The animals are also just as adorable as the pictures. It was great feeding them while also getting to know Colleen and Vern.
Colleen gave us a list of dog-friendly vineyards for our wine tasting adventure and she was also helpful in recommending restaurants. We had a wonderful time and we'll stay with them again in the future.
This place is AWESOME. Very interactive with the animals, comfortable and private lodging quarters.

Omgoodness, where to start, hmmm. Colleen is an amazing host. She is warm, communicative and responsive. The wonderful animals, what a joy they were. Be sure to be there for the “running of the goats”. The “barn” was comfortable and very nicely appointed. Very quiet and peaceful. If we’re ever back in the Walla Walla area this will be the place we stay!! Thank you Colleen and Vern!
Thank you Colleen for a wonderful time. Your barn was great, we had a blast and can’t wait to come back. Thanks for making the trip special for our little one.

Colleen was wonderful. So sweet and accommodating. She had marshmallows and carrots ready for my daughter to feed the animals, which she loved! One of the most comfortable beds I’ve slept in. It was lovely.

I strongly recommend this place for anyone staying in Walla, Walla instead of one of the generic hotels and I especially recommend it for anyone traveling with a dog. The fenced-in yard was great for sitting outside and easily letting our dogs out. The place was clean, quiet, and the hosts were great to work with and very accommodating. My wife and I will definitely stay there again.
We are visiting more than once and it’s such a good feeling that our dog is welcome as well
Super cute and cozy place!! Perfect for a couple or couple with small child. They were very welcoming and especially welcoming of our furbabies!!
Colleen is a great host , the place is cozy and very quiet . The barn animals are a big plus and our dog was very welcome there . We already booked our next visit with her .

Wonderful place to stay. Colleen did a great job of being helpful and supportive while still allowing us to just be without interruptions. She went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed (including a couple items we had forgotten).
This was such an amazing stay! My family and I enjoyed feeding the animals and conversing with the hosts. The place is cozy, beautiful and in a great location. We will definitely be back!

Super cute place! Perfect for me, my husband, and two kids. We were greeted right away & we got to feed the goats, horses, & chickens. Very clean place with everything you need. Very accommodating hosts, very friendly. Highly recommend! We also brought our two small dogs & love the fenced off area for them.

This lovely apartment on farm property was ideal to Walla Walla for our family with pets. The place was efficient and cozy. The hosts were excellent. I loved visiting the animals. This was a special place to stay that made me feel relaxed first-thing on my visit.

Very quiet! East drive to downtown. Great yard for the dogs. We were invited to interact with the animals and evening chat. Colleen’s is a convenient location to the local area and a peaceful stay. Very responsive to questions. Colleen and her husband are provided a warm welcome and a very nice stay. If we’re in the area in the future, we’ll stay here again.

Colleen's place was absolute PERFECTION. Super cute, impeccably clean, and she and her husband were so gracious about greeting us and letting us hang out with the furry and feathered friends on the farm. The fold out couch isn't 100% comfortable for an adult, but if you're traveling with kids or sharing the main bed, I would be hard-pressed to fine any fault. Super location for wine tasting and would 100% stay again!
Wonderful experience. Country living at its best. Friendly hosts offered 1st class hospitality. When visiting Walla Walla, choose Colleen for your stay.

Colleen was a fantastic host! She made herself available to show us her brood of animals and offer advice about getting the most out of our time in Walla Walla! The space was just what we needed--very cozy with all the amenities we needed. The location was lovely--just a short drive from Walla Walla but on the outskirts with a gorgeous view of the mountains. We would come back in a heart beat, we had so much fun!

Colleen and her husband were consummate hosts. They greeted us upon arrival and introduced us to all the friendly animals on the farm. The accommodations were very comfortable and idyllic. My girlfriend and I agreed it was the best place to stay in Walla Walla.
My stay was great. I highly recommend staying in this cute, comfortable Airbnb. Colleen and her husband were great hosts.
Colleen was a perfect host, and my daughter and I had a nice stay. It was a bonus getting to feed treats to the horses and goats!

Staying with Colleen is more than just getting a cozy-as-heck room that is close to downtown Walla Walla and a bunch of wineries. It's what the folks at AirBNB aspired to make when they created the company in the first place. It's an experience in and of itself.
Communication was easy peasy with Colleen. We let her know that our arrival time would be a wildcard because of the road trip we were taking and she made our VERY late arrival super easy and comfortable. The morning after we got to see the goats commute to their pen, fed horses carrots and marshmallows, and met the family chickens and pups. We were so enamored with the goings on at the AirBNB that we almost forgot their were wineries to get to, a car show to experience, and a farmers market to get fresh produce at.
On top of that, Colleen made it easier to make a list of things to do in town with her helpful knowledge of the local food spots and wineries. We followed her recommendation on The Maple Counter for Saturday brunch and I had some of the best biscuits and gravy of my life.
I could go on but I think you, the prospective visitor to Colleen's barn, understand. If you're heading to Walla Walla and need a place to stay, I could not recommend this spot enough. It felt like you were hunkering down with family (you can stand) for the weekend. All the stars!

Colleen’s place is truly one of a kind and one of the best Air BnB’s we’ve stayed in. Their property is so beautiful and such a wonderful place to escape to. The location is fabulous! You feel removed from it all, but within 10mins you’re either at a winery or at the heart of downtown. Colleen was very communicative, hospitable, and had so many fabulous recommendations! We can’t wait to come back and stay again! Colleen helped make our anniversary getaway extra special. Thank you so much Colleen!

We stayed with Coleen and her husband for a long weekend, and had a wonderful stay with them. Don’t let the “barn” part fool you, the private room and bathroom are very comfortable and has all the necessary amenities. If you have a EV there is the ability to 220 charge your car. We also brought our dog with us, he enjoyed the private fenced yard and all the smells. Colleen and her husband were great hosts and offered great recommendations for wineries and restaurants. We’ll definitely stay with them again.
Great hosts, great hospitality! Perfect for our pup. Clean and cool in the heat. We’ll be back!

This is the perfect getaway in Walla Walla if you are looking for something truly unique and special. The room had everything we needed and the bed was very comfortable and Colleen and Vern were exceptionally warm and kind. The location is great - close to town but you feel that country relaxation. The best part is spending time with Mocha and Shaman the horses, the goats, chickens and dogs. We look forward to coming back soon.

The barn was cozy and comfortable, a perfect oasis after wine tastings and family get togethers. And the goats!! Meeting/feeding them was a special treat. Colleen and Vern were amazing hosts. So glad we stayed here!

Absolutely the best Airbnb ever! The barn is just adorable. The location was perfect, close to both the downtown and to all the wineries. The hostess couldn’t have been any nicer. We will definitely be back!
We had a great stay at Colleen’s place in Walla Walla! Perfect location and wonderful, dog-friendly accommodations. Highly recommend!

We had the BEST stay at Colleen & Vern's! They are extremely generous hosts, and had every last detail accounted for. They spent lots of time introducing us to their animals (horses, goats, chickens) and encouraged us to feed them. We truly felt at home when staying on the property. Not to mention it's in a great, central location. We will undoubtedly be returning!!

Had a wonderful time at the Vern and Colleen's Ranch, sat together and talked and fed the Goats and Horses and them Chickens !! And who knew that them Chickens loved those marshmallows so much !!!! A awesome location for wine tasting and being in the country, the accommodations are spot on , everything you need is there and the Bed was very comfy !! We will most definitely be coming back !!!!
Thank you Vern and Colleen for a lovely stay
Great location, cozy but also spacious, wonderful hosts, and very friendly animals. Would definitely stay again.

Colleen and Verne were the ideal hosts. We were welcomed immediately and they opened their home and farm to us to enjoy as we liked. I got to feed the horses, goats and chickens, and even with rain the farm is beautiful and lush and the animals beautiful and friendly. For this city chick, in walla walla for a family wedding, to be able to enjoy the countryside so fully was a true bonus. Highly highly recommend!!!
We had an awesome time at Colleen and Vern's barn! Great hosts with a cozy, quiet space in a great location.

This is the best Airbnb I’ve ever stayed at, and it’s not close. It’s small but comfortable, and very thoughtfully appointed. The animals are an absolute delight - horses, goats, and chickens, all friendly enough to eat out of your hand. Colleen and Vern are great hosts and wonderful people, and we spent a perfect Saturday afternoon sitting by the barn with them, drinking sangria, and throwing treats to the goats.
I would give six stars if I could - I can’t wait to return. We came to Walla Walla for a wedding, but will be going back to stay at this amazing Airbnb.

We had a fantastic stay at the farm! Colleen and Verne are friendly, warm and very attentive and gracious hosts. They made us feel comfortable and welcome right from our arrival. It was really fun to meet the animals on the farm as well… our little one had the most wonderful time. They had great local recommendations for us, which made our trip!
Our stay was warm and nice, and we had everything we needed. With certainly recommend their place for couples or small families.
Quiet, Scenic, comfortable, sweet space. Has everything you need and easy access to the entire area. Just the most perfect stay!

This apartment was perfect and exactly what we were looking for. Colleen and her husband were BEYOND helpful and so friendly. The bed was the best I've ever slept in. The little fenced yard was perfect for our dog. We loved meeting and feeding the horses and goats. We really enjoyed our stay and will be back!

This space is well equipped, quiet, comfortable, clean, and located a short driving distance from the restaurants, wine tasting, and shops that downtown has to offer. The hosts are very friendly and accommodating and the farm setting is charming and welcoming. We loved getting to see and feed the animals when we weren’t exploring Walla Walla. Highly recommend!
Cute apartment, fun location. Hosts were friendly and accommodating

We had such a wonderful time at the "Walla Walla Zoo!" From feeding all of the animals, to riding a tractor, to staying in a beautiful, well-kept apartment, we couldn't have asked for more! It was one of our best experiences through Airbnb. Can't wait to go back!
Colleen’s barn apartment was comfy, convenient, and very well appointed! The fenced in area for the dogs was particularly welcome after several days on a long cross country drive!

Super cozy stay. Warm and comfie. Quiet and peaceful. Great snuggling spot! And Colleen and Vern are lovely and welcoming. Also goats. I love goats. And our dog was very happy with all the smells and four legged people to meet! We will be back for sure!
Cutiest little barn themed bungalow! Nice and clean. The dogs loved it too. Would definitely stay again! You can feed and visit their live stock too. Colleen and hubby were very hospitable!
Always love this place, great location and a perfect little get away location!

We enjoyed our stay at the barn, the host were very friendly and made sure we had anything/everything we needed.
This worked out perfect for us with our 2 large dogs while visiting Walla Walla.

Gorgeous views and the room is stunning. The pictures do not give it justice. It’s just a few minutes from downtown and wineries. The hosts are extremely friendly and willing to help out with anything. My friend brought a quiche to make for breakfast but didn’t realize there was not an oven in the room. Colleen found a toaster oven that worked perfectly for us to use. She’s just very giving and thoughtful. We would definitely stay here again!
Great hosts, convenient location, friendly animals for the kiddies

Trust the reviews/ratings, this place is incredible. If you love animals and a quiet/relaxing spot, this is the perfect airbnb. On top of that, Colleen has amazing communication and is so friendly and welcoming. Will definitely be back

This is a sweet apartment that provides a quick walk down the road to a beautiful walk in the country as you walk towards the Blue Mountain Range. The hosts, Colleen and Vern were friendly and helpful with suggestions for wineries close by. The goats and chickens out back were a great addition to the tiny barn experience!

The room is clean, spacious, and comfortable with a fully fenced front yard which was perfect for our dog and kids to play. Colleen and Vern are kind, helpful, and very accommodating. We had a wonderful time feeding the animals and visiting with our hosts!

We had a great stay here! Nothing like being greeted by friendly horses and goats (behind fencing), and getting to feed them was so fun. The place was clean and tidy, andva bottle of wine awaited us next to the 4k TV. One highlight for me was the huge shower with great pressure and hot water! The king sized bed was cozy, and the fenced in yard was perfect for our dog. Great place to stay!

We've stayed in Walla Walla many times -- and this place is a gem. The unit was spacious and airy with a little fenced grassy yard where we could sit out in the evening (with the dogs -- who loved it also). Many nice touches inside and out. Colleen and her husband welcomed us warmly, provided some great recommendations for restaurants, and made us feel right at home. The horses and goats were fun to watch and feed! And the views of the wheat fields and the Blue Mts. rising above them were just beautiful. There are many motels in town, and a few high end places -- but Colleen's place is truly special. Just perfect for us and our adult daughter and pups.

Great little unique spot. Close to the wineries and town. We were in for a wedding so it was a quick one night stay. The bed was very comfortable and the wine was a nice touch. It was also very clean.
Such a cute place and great hosts. Friendly farm animals too and nice fenced in yard for our dog too. Great location to town as well. Will stay again for sure.

Must stay! This was our favorite Air BNB we have ever stayed at. The hosts and the animals are super friendly. Our dog is usually nervous in new places but he waltzed right in and felt at home right away. He loved all the space to run around and had a blast playing with the goats. We will 100% be coming back here again.

Just as described, an extremely comfortable spot for humans as well as critters.
A really comfortable bed, nice touches such as ambient lighting and night lights, a big shower, fabulous towels.
Outdoors is a fenced area for a pooch, with patio chairs for the human companions. Additionally a large lawn, corrals for horses and goats, AND extremely gracious and hospitable hosts.
I spent two days in respite from a family adventure gathering in one state and a coming wedding in another.
Walla Walla has many charms, but I stayed put and felt nourished and renewed with my very young dog.
Wonderful stay! Welcoming hosts and a beautiful location. Our daughter loved to meet the goats, chickens and horses.
Colleen’s place is ideal if you are traveling with dogs. We had an excellent time. She provided wonderful food and winery recommendations. I even got to hold some baby chicks!

This is hands down the best Airbnb experience my wife and I have ever had. We stayed with our 3-year-old son and 15-year-old dog, who both loved it as well.
The studio itself that you stay in is wonderful, cozy and perfectly put together. You have a fenced in front lawn to yourself with comfortable chairs, a great place to sit and relax. The farm that you're on has horses, goats and chickens that you can feed and get to know. Our kid loved feeding the horses and goats, and he spent a lot of time chasing the chickens (of course never catching them). There were fruit trees where he picked apples and pears to feed to the cows next door.
Beyond the place itself, Colleen and Vern (the hosts) are incredibly welcoming, fun, helpful and easy-going. We're grateful to have met them.
And finally, Walla Walla is just a few minutes away driving, where we had excellent meals and a good time walking around, and the Blue Mountains are about a 15 minute drive in the other direction - we had a beautiful afternoon driving through the farms and up into the hills.
We couldn't recommend this Airbnb more!!!

Colleen’s place was everything we imagined and more. She and her husband went above and beyond to make sure that we had everything we needed as well as recommended some great local places to check out. I highly recommend staying at Colleen’s place if you are looking for a place of comfort, excellent hospitality, and friendly animals!

Beautiful, quiet setting. Nice, fenced area for our dog and hosts were so accommodating. We needed extra room to trailer a car down and Coleen and Vern had plenty of space. They gave us great dog-friendly suggestions for wineries and restaurants and while things are still a little unsure with COVID, the apartment was so clean and comfortable! A perfect getaway!!!

We loved this place!! Colleen and Vern were wonderful hosts and met us with cold drinks and a nice visit! And a bottle of wine!! We got to feed treats to the horses and goats and spend time wirh an adorable baby chicken! The bed was comfortable and it had a beautiful bathroom with a big shower. The
location was perfect--it was quiet but close to downtown and the wineries. We would definitely stay again!

Colleen and Vern are wonderful hosts! We had an incredible stay with our two dogs. We enjoyed a beer with Colleen and Vern on the first night, met all their animals and got advice on local wineries. The bed was very comfortable and the a/c kept us cool on two very hot days/nights!! It was such a pleasure to soend time at this very animal friendly airbnb. We will def come back to stay at Vern and Colleen’s place!!!!
Wonderful hospitality and such a unique and lovely space. Thank you so much, the kids absolutely loved it and we can’t wait to come back.

Incredible stay! Colleen and Vern were wonderful hosts. We had a great time visiting with them and enjoying the horses, goats and chickens. The goats in particular were a riot to watch. The little baby goats are so playful. The space is very well done (living area/bedroom combo and large bathroom) with lots of special touches. They’ve done a beautiful job decorating the home and making it warm and inviting. The barn conversion is very creative - loved all the decorative touches! The bed was super comfy and we slept great!! Picturesque mountain views from the property were such a treat. The hosts were very thoughtful and provided a bottle of wine upon arrival, waters and other things like coffee and tea. Great suggestions also for restaurants and fun things to do. Highly recommend this darling place!

This is a beautifully kept place and a lot of fun - out of the box and a country type of experience! We fed the horses, pet the goats and enjoyed talking to Colleen and Vern so very much. It’s close to downtown and many other wineries and really close to Slieght of Hand - our favorite winery that we visited!

My wife and I had a wonderful three-night stay at Colleen and Vern's beautiful farm paradise. We whole-heartedly recommend their Airbnb. It is located about five minutes from tons of wineries and downtown Walla Walla's restaurants and parks. Their goats and chickens are a joy, as are Colleen and Vern themselves. We would definitely stay with them again.

We had a fantastic time, Colleen and her husband are really wonderful hosts. The unit is great, super-clean and comfortable. There's a nice private grassy area but it's great to sit with the hosts and have a beer or two as well. We had our dogs with us and it worked out great, the grassy area was perfect for them to roam around a little and lounge. I would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to others.
Colleen is a wonderful host! Highly recommend!

This place is what Airbnb is all about. Great host, amazing experience, location, and so much different and better than a hotel. A+ experience all around and will definitely be staying again in the future. It’s a nice space and comes with the bonus horses, goats, and chickens!

Colleen and her husband were the best hosts and we LOVED their place. Our 2 year old had an absolute blast visiting the horses, goats, and chickens. We’ve stayed in a lot of places and this was our favorite of anywhere!

Colleen’s place had everything we and our 2 dogs needed! It was spotlessly clean, very comfortable, with lots of room for us and the dogs. Colleen and her husband were gracious hosts and their home is in a quiet neighborhood near downtown Walla Walla. We hope to come back and spend more time!
Really lovely place with lots of privacy. Lots of animals to play with

This is a wonderful lodging, and is short-drive convenient to both downtown and southside wineries and dining. Colleen and Vern have gone to great lengths in making the accommodations welcoming and comfortable. Everything is modern and new. Getting to watch the running of the goats and chickens, and enjoying a glass of wine or beer while watching GoatTV in the evening helps round out the experience w a smile or laugh. We hope to return soon!
Great for a couple. Quiet, close to downy.

We had an awesome stay and it was a really fun spot for our pup too! The place is clean, comfy, and is a perfect location between the wineries and downtown. Colleen and her husband are wonderful hosts and we would love to stay here again next time we visit Walla Walla!
Great spot! Clean, welcoming and wonderful touches! Highly recommend.

I normally don't write long reviews because I just forget or run out of time or am too busy. But I wanted to make sure to write a review for Colleen and Vern's place. It was awesome. They communicated well, the place was as advertised (or even better), and everything was very clean. Lucy, my French bulldog, entertained herself by chasing chickens and goats. Jasmin, my friend, got to walk one of the horses and feed them. I had to work, a lot, and the space was creative and perfect for getting things done. Every evening we knew we could sit outside and have a beer (or water, whatever you'd like) with Colleen or Vern or both. We really enjoyed our three days here! Can't say enough good things.

Colleen and her husband are certainly SUPER HOSTS. We really enjoyed our restful time there! The animals were so fun to watch, feed and pet. The location was so close to wineries and to downtown yet felt like you were out in the country. Everything exceeded our expectations!!!

Perfect stay! Colleen and family welcomed my dogs and I like we were family. Not to mention the baby goats! Bed and accommodations were very clean and comfortable. Location is near downtown as well as the south side wineries.

This well kitted place is amazing! Sparkling clean and such a unique experience. Baby goats and beautiful horses to pet and feed carrots to. Close to city center, wineries and restaurants. The hosts are so kind and gracious and we really enjoyed getting to know them. Extra special touches throughout. We will definitely be back and so highly recommend this beautiful space!

Colleen’s spot was really comfortable, and great with traveling with our pets. We loved the bed, and bedding it was really comfortable. And, they were really friendly, helpful and knowledgeable with recommending local spots to check out. The internet and cable was a nice treat in the airbnb (I ended up running 30 miles for a local Trail Race, and so it was nice to sit down and watch tv for a bit at the end of the night!). I also really liked the shower, and towels were really nice. And, I loved the Barn Theme- and Rodeo artwork, and they gave us a bottle of “Dark Horse” Red Wine as a welcome gift which was really nice, and my Hubby really appreciated the microwave popcorn as a Saturday night snack while watching SNL! Overall, it was fun being out there, my dogs loved roaming around the property, and it was neat seeing their horses and other animals around. The highlight was getting to hold their baby goat that was born 4/6/2021 and we saw it on Friday 4/9/2021! So sweet!
Heaven on earth for my 4yo son. Colleen and Vern are magnificent hosts and their amazing home is a wonderland of interesting animals, good conversation and relaxing accommodations. Highly recommend.
Very cute place, close to the tasting rooms (5-7mins drive). The horses were so sweet and the host gave us carrots to feed them. The goats were also fun and playful! Would totally stay there again!

Colleen was really friendly and offered us great tips for places to eat. Also the bed was amazingly comfortable- we slept so well. And feeding the horses and petting the goats was a lovely perk. It's super dog friendly- she provided towels in case our pup got wet/muddy and there were even extra poop bags. Overall a great stay and would definitely stay again!

Place was absolutely darling and charming. So many thoughtful touches by the host including wine and carrots to feed the horses. Would be a great romantic stay for wine tasting and touring the countryside.
Loved it so much we came back again!

Colleen and her family were absolutely amazing. Their hospitality and thoughtful touches made our trip one we will remember forever. The accommodations were super comfortable and very clean. Such a beautiful place to stay, hosted by great people!

A great place to stay in Walla Walla, about 5 minutes or so from downtown and situated on over an acre. And if you have pooches in tow (like we did) this is THE PLACE. Really nice space - a converted portion of the barn with all the amenities - and everything updated and clean. Plus carrots to feed the horses and a bottle of wine on arrival..
PROTIP: At the host's recommendation we had breakfast at The Maple Counter. Mind blown!
Would definitely stay here again.
Wonderfully charming little spot. Super close to just about everything you would want to check out in walla walla . Thoughtful and gracious hosts! Would totally stay here again.

Do yourself a favor and book this place ASAP! This was one of our favorite places we’ve stayed. Colleen and her husband were so communicative and hospitable. They honestly made us feel right at home. Their barn was comfortable, stylish and very clean. And the tour of the farm was an added bonus. We had a lot of fun petting Wilma the goat and giving carrots to horses Shaman and Mocha. We can’t wait to stay here again!
Super cute and cozy! For both humans and dogs! Great hospitality!

Great place to stay at Walla Walla! Good places to eat around this area.
The hosts were kind and welcoming. The interior is very classy and a good place to stay. Recommend to stay if you are around here :)

Staying here was perfect! From the location, to the warm hospitality, to the most comfortable bed and bedding this is the place to stay when visiting Walla Walla in December or anytime of the year! The space was warm and inviting and 100% comfortable for my husband and me. Super for a couples getaway or when visiting family and just need a little extra space. We loved it!

Colleen’s place was truly a treasure nestled in Walla Walla. The overall experience was more than I was anticipating and my family was able to make some wonderful memories. We would highly recommend a visit at this little gem!

Colleen was a FANTASTIC host! She had amazing recommendations for what to do and eat in Walla Walla (trust her restaurant picks!), her hospitality went above and beyond anything I’ve ever experienced at an Airbnb! Hanging out with the horses, adorable goats, chickens, dogs, cats - and obviously her family - was so wonderful and we felt so welcome. It was a truly fun experience! We were just passing through on our road trip, but we are so excited to return to Walla Walla again! There is no better place to stay than with her at her beautiful property!!!
We enjoyed an afternoon and evening at Colleen’s place. Our 10 year old was delighted with all of the animals. The setting was perfect for us.
Second time here—one of the best Airbnb’s we’ve stayed at. Can’t say enough good things about the hospitality and great farm experience.

Second time staying here and loved it once again! Remarkably clean, safe, well furnished, comfy bed, friendly and accommodating hosts. Everything works perfectly. Couldn't ask for more from an AirBnB. Looking forward to the third visit when opportunity presents.

My friend and I had a wonderful stay at Colleen's place. Everything was very clean and comfortable, and the close proximity to Walla Walla and surrounding wineries was very convenient! Colleen and her husband are very friendly and we also had an opportunity to meet their goats and horses. We would definitely stay here again!

Colleen and her family are excellent hosts! We also loved visiting with the chickens, goats, and horses. The location of the studio is excellent- close to wineries and downtown. We really enjoyed our stay!
Beautiful place in wine country, minutes from downtown Walla Walla. Very wonderful host and place was super cute and very dog friendly!

My girlfriend and I spent 4th of July weekend here, and it was perfect thanks to Colleen and her family, and the space we rented. They were extremely nice and helpful, and very responsive. They had goats that we were allowed to play with. It is a great location within a quick drive to so many wineries.
The place was very clean and comfortable, and the yard was a great spot to enjoy some of the wine we purchased from the wineries.
All in all, it was a perfect weekend!
Great place to stay with wonderful hosts and small farm animals!
Great location close to wineries and very pet friendly. Our golden retriever loved meeting the baby goats. We had a great stay and definitely recommend
Horses, baby goats, and a super comfy bed in wine country..what more could you ask for!? Hosts were super friendly and made us feel right at home. Would definitely go back
This AirBnB was beautiful and filled with thoughtful touches. Colleen and her family were extremely welcoming. Great location and very comfortable stay. We even met some baby goats!

Exceptional! Colleen and her family welcomed us with open arms. Being from farmland I felt right at home, from the hospitality to the generosity Colleen exceeded all our expectations! My family now has a safe haven for our two year old to roam.

Perfection in every way possible! Perfect for our doggies, friendly and responsive hosts, quiet location, the comfiest bed ever, adorable goats, great decor & amenities, a nice bottle of wine...even friendly neighbors! Only wish we could have stayed longer! You won’t be disappointed!

Highly recommend Colleen's place lovely airbnb getaway. Very welcoming and relaxing. Colleen was ever so thoughtful and gracious. Our pup was so sad to leave Colleen's and his new friendly farm critter friends. Thank you Colleen for everything ❤️❤️❤️
Everything advertised plus a few nice touches

Great place for a couple if you are in the WW area. Quiet & comfortable. Easy access to town. Colleen is very attentive to her guests and very helpful with info as the whole area had been hit with flooding days before our arrival.
We had a great stay at Colleen's barn. It has all the comforts of home and more. Colleen was a great host with great communication and suggestions. Highly recommend.
Such welcoming hosts and a lovely space! Would love to stay here again

This place is absolutely perfect. I stayed here one night with two of my girlfriends and my dogs and we all wished we could have stayed longer. The horses, the decor, and the fabulous host make this the perfect spot in Walla Walla!

Colleen and Vern are definitely super hosts that made us feel very comfortable and welcome. We enjoyed the farm atmosphere and look forward to returning. The location is convenient and perfect for exploring the Walla Walla area.

Colleen’s place is a must the next time you are in Walla Walla. Very clean and excellent location just out of town. Suggestions on wineries and places to eat were very helpful! Colleen and her husband were also gracious in letting us feed the horses and goats. So much fun! The turkeys and chickens were also very entertaining. Next time we are in Walla Walla this is where we will stay!
Wonderful barn, great location just outside of town. Perfect for a couple or in our case three adults.

I went to walla walla on a trip for work and wanted to find a pet friendly place so I could bring my dogs. Colleen was very welcoming and the place was perfect. I enjoyed being away from things but also being so close to work. The apartment was gorgeous and very clean, I didn’t have any issues during my stay and my dogs enjoyed it too!

Clean, attractive, quiet, with very attentive and friendly hosts in the main house and lots of animals to "animate" your stay! A beautiful vista out over the hills and a great yard to play ball. You feel like you are out in the country, but really only a few minutes from downtown. Our dogs loved it and so did we!

Great location.,. just far enough out of town but not too much. We were able to go for a run right from the property. Quiet, clean and comfortable. A treat to find a truly pet-friendly location that didn't charge outrageous rates. She let us feed the horses, which was a unique experience for us. I would recommend and will stay again if we return to Walla Walla!
Colleen suggested all the dog friendly wineries for us. The barn was clean, adorable and memorable.

Colleen and her family went out of her way to welcome both me and my mom to Walla Walla. We were looking forward to a weekend of wine drinking in the country. What we got was a family that welcomed us to their newly built Airbnb with open arms and an interest in sharing everything they love about home. This family extends themselves in a way that makes the trip to WW unforgettable!

Colleen’s studio apartment is perfect for a weekend getaway to Walla Walla. If you love animals, this is the place for you. Also, most of the southern Walla Walla wineries are within a 5 min drive. Perfect
Friendly hosts and a beautiful space. Our stay was perfect. We also loved being able to visit with the resident animals.
This is great place to rest and relax. Wonderful location.

Excellent!!! Beautiful!! The barn room we stayed in is super cute and well-decorated, giving a clean chic ranch feel. There was plenty of k-cups for the keurig coffee machine and wine! The room and bathroom were spacious, especially the shower! The hosts are very friendly and flexible with our arrival time. They communicated and responded efficiently. The ranch is located in a beautiful part of Walla Walla that is safe, clean, and gorgeous. The goats on the ranch were sooo cute (we got to pet them too!). I totally recommend this place for any stays in Walla Walla and the Pendleton Round-Up... we will definitely be back!

This is a fantastic, rural, quiet place to relax. The hosts make you feel welcome, even if you don't meet. The comfort level is top notch. Great care was obviously taken to make guests feel welcome and provided with nice amenities like quality bath products and cushy towels, Keurig coffee maker and variety of pods, creamer and water bottles in the mini fridge, bottle of wine and they even left the lights on for us to arrive late. Don't hesitate to stay here, if you are in the area.
The accommodations were better than we expected. Location was close to downtown, area wineries, & it was quiet...just what we were looking for.

This was the perfect place to stay to enjoy Walla Walla, the surrounding vineyards, and the landscape of the area. Colleen has made a really cool experience for her guests and has a great welcoming committee of polite barnyard animals.

What a wonderful weekend!
Colleen & Vern are fabulous hosts who greeted us with wine at their beautiful Walla Walla retreat. The room(s) are lovely, fresh and clean and the towels super fluffy.
We got engaged during our stay and our announcement was receive with hugs all around! We will be back! Thank you Colleen & Vern
Sharon & Michael
We had a great time in Walla Walla! This is a great place to stay, not far from anything you would want to do. Colleen gave us some great tips on where to go that was perfect for us. Thanks again!
Very nice space. Clean and comfortable and lots of nice touches.

My family and I had a great time staying here! Very comfy with three adults and a dog. Colleen and her family were gracious hosts and were very attentive. The horses are a great added bonus to be able to feed or groom.

The barn suite was wonderful! Easy access to down town and south-side wineries, and evenings by the pasture with friendly ponies was a wonderful treat. Speaking of treats, Colleen provided us with lots of horse treats to help us get acquainted with our fellow barn residents. There’s nothing like a glass of wine and a friendly horse to make for an enjoyable stay in Walla Walla!

Colleen and her husband are very welcoming and gave us a tour of their lovely property as well as lots of local tips! The separate apartment on the side of the barn is super cute and stylish and also a good size. It's also much closer to town than I had realized, which was great! Colleen was available if we had any questions, and also let us meet the animals and feed the horses some treats, which was super fun.

We came to Walla Walla to celebrate my 60th birthday in the valley’ wine country. Staying here was a delightful surprise and added bonus! We were met by the hosts and knew upon meeting them that they are good souls. Knowing it was my birthday - a bottle of wine was waiting along with great tips on where to go wine tasting and where to eat. All great recommendations and truly felt at home. On my birthday - Colleen dropped off some cupcakes that were easily some of the best I have ever eaten! Their place is a gem and we felt welcome and at home. We recommend you stay - you will be god you did! And Walla Walla is a charming town filled with very nice people! We will be back!
This property was just as comfortable and charming as described. Though my stay was brief, the barn was the perfect location to rest my head on my visit to the Walla Walla area.

Colleen's place was immaculate and exactly as described. There were loads of thoughtful touches and it was extremely comfortable! It was just three minutes down the road from Walla Walla downtown, but felt a world away in terms of peace and natural beauty. We highly recommend staying here if you are in the area. Thanks so much Colleen for being an excellent and welcoming host!

What a wonderful stay in Walla Walla! If you plan to visit Washington wine country look no further than Colleen's place. The unit was well appointed with a comfortable king sized bed, and a nice large shower. it was also cleverly decorated in a country theme. Her place is also very pet friendly, which is a huge bonus for dog owners that like to travel with their dogs. The space was a great value and we would definitely stay here again! We even got to pet her horses!
We’d do it again!

What a fantastic place! Colleen and Verne are great hosts, very accommodating and friendly. We loved getting to meet the horses and our dog loved getting to run around the property. The layout of the barn makes it feel like you have your own semi-private yard to relax and enjoy a glass of wine in. Great location, only a few minutes from downtown and the Southside wineries. Incredibly clean space, my husband is pretty allergic to horses but didnt have any problems staying here. We will definitely be coming to Colleen's on our next Walla Walla trip!
Great hosts! We very much enjoyed the sweet country environment and cozy atmosphere. Highly recommended!
We loved the barn so much that we stayed there again when we visited Walla Walla. Such a perfect little retreat for us.

What a great 4 days! Everything was perfect..the barn, location, views, but best of all was Coleen and her family! Thank you for a wonderful, memorable experience. You won’t be disappointed staying here!
We absolutely loved our stay! Colleen and Vern are so friendly and hospitable and the place is spotless. Being able to feed the horses was an added bonus! Thank you!

Amazing experience with Colleen and her family! They were friendly and one of the best hosts ever.
They gave us a tour of their ranch introducing the horses, chickens and other animals, even allowed us to feed the horses.
The room we stayed in was super clean and quiet still they asked us if their was any noise by the horses. We stayed for 2 nights but didnot even realize that they have horses.
They welcomed our dog too and made us feel at home.
We loved the family, their horses and all other animals.
Very nice and humble family, fun to be around them. We will always remember the pleasant experience we had and will come back again. Thank you so much!

Colleen and Vern were great hosts! Awesome location close to downtown Walla Walla on a property with horses, chickens, dogs and cats. And you can bring your dog! The space is perfect - very clean, stylish, and has everything you need for a relaxing stay.
Pleasant space, nice and quiet, and easy access to things in town.
The place is very well decorated and clean.. super comfty bed and overall great spot. Cute dogs and nice horses, would recommend to someone with pets.

We can't say enough positive things about this place. Colleen and her husband were very gracious hosts; the property itself was lovely and secluded enough, and made for a very comfortable getaway. We would not hesitate to stay here again if ever in the area.
So peaceful and relaxing. Such great interactions with their guests. I loved it and will stay again.
Nice place - loved the horses!

We had such a great time! We didn't really have any huge plans in Walla Walla since we had been there many times, but just came out to enjoy the area. Interacting with Colleen and her family (and the horses) just added to a fantastic weekend for us. The space was super fun, and we enjoyed just hanging out in it. She gave us great recommendations for dinner and wineries. We FaceTimed our daughter who is away at college, and she was sad (jealous) that she couldn't be there, so we will definitely be back!

If you are looking for the perfect place that reflects all that Walla Walla has to offer this is the place to be. Best night sleep ever, bed is soft comfy, nice large shower, view is amazing, peaceful setting, and the best hostess in all of Walla Walla.
Wonderful place to stay & would stay there again when I am in Walla Walla

This airbnb is in a very pleasant backyard of a lovely neighborhood in Walla Walla. Although the profile for this place said check-in required connecting with host, it ended up all being automated, which is much easier on the guest. I really liked the looks of the interior - it was creative (tankless on-demand water heater) and attractive (beautiful floors). I appreciated all of the really clear directions they included in a folder on using the key, the remotes, etc. It was extremely well stocked and the sheets were super soft. Not a single complaint.
Always a pleasure to stay at Scott’s. Within walking distance of Whitman College and downtown Walla Walla. Peaceful, super clean, and comfortable. Scott is a responsive and accommodating host.

Scott's home was close to many of our wine tasting adventures during the afternoons and a quiet place to retreat at the end of the day. His guest home is cozy, clean and comfortable. It was the perfect setting for the two of us.
We would enjoy staying there again on our next visit to Walla Walla.
Great location. Nice touches with coffee/tea, and small snacks. Great instructions on using items such as TV, heater/AC and door locking. Very responsive and proactive Hosts.

Wonderful little cottage with everything I could have needed for my stay. Fantastic location in downtown Walla Walla in a safe, fun neighborhood by the college. Scott is a great host and check in and checkout was super easy. Will definitely stay here again when I’m visiting in the fall.
Can’t say enough. Perfectly perfect!! Thank you for such an enjoyable stay!!
The place was exactly as described. It was in a great location. easy driving to restaurants, shopping and wineries. The cottage was clean, well stocked and very comfortable. Thanks for a great stay!

Such a gem! The cottage was absolutely perfect. It was clean, private, the bed was very comfortable. We only stayed one night, but wished we had booked another. The neighborhood is charming and peaceful. We loved walking into downtown, which was less than 10 minutes. The walk through Whitman’s campus was beautiful. Scott was very nice, communicative and available if we had questions. We never needed to reach out because everything was made easy and well explained, but he made it comfortable to contact him if needed. I highly recommend staying here, and can’t wait to come back!
Very cozy and beautiful! Pictures does not do it Justice!! We really felt like it was home away from home!
Wonderful place! Hosts were very friendly. Highly recommended!
Great spot in a nice neighborhood. The place had everything we needed.

We made a quick one night stay here since I was having a procedure locally. Scott messaged me back letting me know how easily accessible the cottage entrance was since he was aware of my procedure. I thought that was very thoughtful! Very private, tons of amenities in the room for our convenience, spotless, smart TV for easy login on apps, etc. Will stay there again if we are in town!
Quiet, super clean space. Responsive and friendly host. Great place to stay.
My husband and I had a really good stay at Scott’s place. It is in a really nice, quiet neighborhood. His place is very cute and comfortable! We would like to stay again when visiting Walla Walla.

I could not have stayed at a more convenient or lovely location. Scott's place is close to all the gorgeousness of Whitman College in a wonderful quiet neighborhood, probably describes all neighborhoods in Walla Walla. Scott and his wife were warm and friendly hosts. The accommodations cannot be beat. Clean, nicely designed and convenient in every way. Perfect for one or two people. Don't hesitate to book.
Fabulous stay with welcoming hosts! Space was as advertised and peaceful. Tastefully decorated and everything you need for a short stay in Walla Walla.

I have been a guest here on multiple occasions. This unit is very private, quiet plus it is super convenient to Whitman and downtown. The bed is comfortable, the bathroom is spotless and the little kitchenette has everything you need. I also really appreciate the off street parking.
Clean, quiet, comfortable, and close to everything we needed.
We had a fabulous stay here while in Walla Walla! The place was comfortable and cozy and clean and in a great location. We would definitely recommend it to our friends and stay here again!
Picturesque cottage! Comfortable and clean. Very convenient location in Walla Walla. With a college student nearby, I will stay here again!
Generous hosts with a charming home in an excellent location. I enjoyed walking to main street and appreciated the safe, quiet, and restful neighborhood.
Scott’s place was fabulous and perfect for our Whitman visit. We loved the snacks, the chocolates were a lovely treat.

Our stay at Marqui and Scott’s was wonderful. Very clean and had everything we might need. The outdoor patio was nice. When the internet connection was down, Scott was responsive and fixed the problem quickly- very appreciated! We would stay again!!

The cottage was lovely. We stayed here to go wine tasting and the location was perfect to walk into town. We were greeted at the door on arrival and given the keys. Everything was clean. I really appreciate the cleaning fee being low. It was a big part of why we chose to stay here. Affordable, clean, and a great location!
Enjoyed meeting both Scott and Marqui. The unit was very cute, clean, and in a lovely neighborhood.
Thanks for hosting! the spot was just lovely, and the perfect end to a cross-country drive!

We had a lovely stay at Scott and Marqui’s sweet little backyard cottage. It was comfortable, clean, cute, private, and had everything we needed. Great value and we would definitely stay again during a future visit. Highly recommend!
Sweet little guest house in a beautiful neighborhood. It has everything you need for a short stay in Walla Walla. The space was super cute and cozy. We would definitely stay again.

I have been a quest here on several occasions and just love this place. Scott is always very responsive and check in is incredibly easy. This unit is very close to downtown and also Whitman. I really appreciate the off street parking, well stocked kitchenette, comfortable bed and a spotless bathroom. I will definitely be back.

Scott was a great host. Communicative and friendly. Great local winery recommendations. Space is private, despite being in the hosts backyard, as you park in the driveway and walk through the gate to the front door of the unit. Patio space was a nice place to relax under a beautiful tree in the morning and evening. We would definitely stay there again.

Awesome place for a couple to spend a few wonderful days in Walla Walla! Very comfortable and convenient to everything that Walla Walla offers. Hosts are friendly and helpful! Don’t hesitate to book Scott’s place.
I think this was our fifth time staying at Scott and Marqui’s place. Perfect for us! Always happy to come back.

Great spot in Walla Walla for our 2 night stay. Scott was responsive and very friendly to all requests. Check in was self-serve which made our arrival a breeze. Easy bike or walk to tasting rooms, restaurants and coffee.
We only stayed one night but it was perfect for our needs. Nice quiet neighborhood and close to downtown. I would recommend his place!
Good stay! However wifi didnt really work very spotty. But overall good
Thank you!
Short walk to downtown from a clean, private guest house

Scott is a great host. The cottage was open when we arrived. The location was a peaceful neighborhood with trees and beautiful homes. We enjoyed relaxing in his backyard. The unit was small but expertly appointed with coffee, dishes, nice fridge, beautiful bathroom and shower. The bed was very comfortable. Although we didn’t walk to downtown (100 degrees out), there was plenty of free parking in the restaurant area. Don’t miss out on a morning walk to pioneer park where there’s an aviary! The location was convenient to wineries and a few breweries. We would definitely recommend Scott’s place for a couple!
Perfect landing spot for a quick trip, comfortable bed and quiet location - would stay here again
Scott and his family were wonderful, and their space was beautiful! It was perfect for our trip, and right in the heart of Walla Walla! I will absolutely be back.

Perfect spot for a single person or couple. Convenient and adorable location, with all the amenities you would need for a little getaway. Very nice touches like the Gatorade pouches after an afternoon of wine tasting 🤪, the pour over coffee and plush towels! Bed was comfy and the space relaxing. Marqui and Scott warmly welcomed me and were available if I needed anything.

Cozy one room with good size bathroom, has pretty much everything you need. Lovely neighborhood and nice walk downtown. I had a little trouble with internet/tv cutting out the first evening, but the next day it was fine. It's perfect for a short stay. Also has nice area for sitting outside. I would definitely stay here again.
Gracious Host and Lovely Stay!
Fantastic stay!! Scott was excellent to rent from!! We were there for a Vintage Show at the Fairgrounds. Location and accommodations were great! We will definitely book again!
Perfect cozy space for two. Super clean! Love the cherry tree!

We had a short stay at Scott’s backyard cottage. Great communication, very clean and furnished with top line appliances such as on-demand hot water, efficient mini-split for cooling and a luxurious shower. Nice quiet location to enjoy Whitman college and the streets of downtown Walla Walla. Highly recommended for those that don’t need a full kitchen or lots of space.

I really enjoyed my stay. The guesthouse had everything I needed: comfy bed, extra towels, luxurious shower, clothes hangers, well-stocked kitchen with kettle and coffee, and a lovely outdoor seating area.
Great communication, location, had everything we needed for a 2 night stay.
I really enjoyed my stay and will definitely return. Everything was as described and the hosts were very friendly.
We will be back! Perfect location
Had another great day at Scott’s place. Thank you again.
This house helped make our short getaway from home comfy, easy and homey. Lovely neighborhood, too.
A great spot in a lovely neighborhood! Clean, peaceful, and within walking distance of Whitman and downtown Walla Walla. Scott is a responsive and helpful host. Highly recommend.
Just a beautiful spot. Very peaceful

Perfect accommodations for a delightful weekend exploring the area and reconnecting with family.
Thoughtful amenities, well appointed guesthouse in a quiet neighborhood close to Whitman College and within walking distance to restaurants and shopping.
We will definitely stay here next time we visit Walla Walla.
Scott is very friendly and responsive. The neighborhood is quiet and felt very safe. Easy walking to everything.

This was such an incredible Airbnb. It was small and cozy, very clean and had everything we needed for a comfortable and nice stay. Scott and his wife were very responsive over message on Airbnb and extremely welcoming. The place is just a few minutes from downtown Walla Walla and very close to a lot of the wineries. My boyfriend and I also slept comfortably in the queen sized bed and the room temperature was very comfortable and adjustable. I would highly reccomend this Airbnb and would no doubt stay again!
wonderful host, proactive and responsive communication, everything as described.
My second stay here and it was lovely. Scott is a great host, too!

Scott was a wonderful host and has a great place in Walla Walla. The check in and out processes were a breeze. They even allowed us the convenience of parking in their driveway. The home is clean and well furnished in a great area, walking distance from Main Street. Not only were the accommodations great but Scott was a wonderful host, making sure we had everything we needed and offering to make dinner suggestions. Would absolutely recommend Scott’s place in Walla Walla
Great place to stay. Super easy parking. Clean. Comfortable. Scott is a great host. Will stay there again
Scott’s sleepover was quiet and beautiful. It was the perfect getaway. Thank you Scott and Marqui! You both were so warm and welcoming after our crazy arrival!

We really enjoyed our stay in Scott’s cozy little house. The space has been maximized for total efficiency and lacked nothing for a couple of days. It was comfy and quiet - just what we needed in the midst of long travels.
This is a wonderful place to stay. Every detail was considered and it was so comfortable too. It’s small but well laid out and perfect furnishings. Look forward to visiting again!
It was our second stay at Scott’s. Just as good as the first time. Fall is beautiful in Walla Walla. Great location, comfy little place, very clean and overall quite enjoyable. 😊
This is a great small place if you want a great location and easy access to downtown.
We loved Scott'splace and the walkability to downtownthru the Whitman campus. The place was very clean and well appointed. Scott and Marqui are very hospitable.
Exactly as advertised. Perfect stay.
Great stay. Everything was made easy for us.
Friendly hosts. Great location. Comfortable BnB. Highly recommended!

We loved our stay at Scott and Marqui's place! It was our first time to Walla Walla and their place was the perfect location for us, walkable to Main Street through the Whitman campus. They were so friendly whenever we bumped into each other, providing directions or suggestions for what to check out. The place had everything we needed as a base for our friend's wedding, from hair dryer and a place to hang our fancy clothes to a comfy bed and kitchen amenities. Thank you!
A great stay as always - I think this was our 5th visit. Happy to have found the perfect spot in Walla Walla!
We loved our short stay at this location. Easy parking, quiet street, lovely amenities in the dwelling. Would stay here again.
Beautiful cottage situated nearby to the Whitman College and downtown Walla Walla. Very well-appointed, quiet and extremely clean. We will be back.
This place is so quaint and cute and completely as described. We will absolutely rent it again when we come back to Walla Walla to visit
Very nicely remodeled ADU. Everything you need for a stay in Walla Walla and very convenient to Whitman College. We will stay again in the future.
Perfect for 1 or 2 people. Everything you need....comfy bed, great coffee nice shower all at a price!
A sweet little space that’s private and comfortable. Hosts were very nice and helpful!
Great spot.

It’s a little gem.. and would recommend staying here.

Lovely place, so clean, and perfect for our stay in walla walla. Best part? Hosts are so accommodating and responsive. They let us use their outdoor garage gym, and meet their adorable pup Luna. Would stay again for sure!

My wife and I loved Scott’s place. The place is absolutely comfortable and quiet in an old neighborhood close to downtown. The walk to downtown takes you through Whitman’s gorgeous campus, a joy unto its own. We will be back when we visit our new favorite Walla Walla winery!

Loved this Airbnb, the space was super clean and comfortable and the location is fantastic for exploring Walla Walla on foot! Marqui & Scott are incredible hosts and provided great recommendations for things to see & do in town!

We loved our stay so much! The location was perfect, the walk across campus to town was lovely & we enjoyed our time sitting out in the beautiful yard. Absolutely loved my stay and would stay here again. Everything was great and super easy to communicate with the host. Thanks again!!
Super cute space; it was perfect for my daughter and I while visiting Whitman College. Very walkable location. I would stay here again.
We had a wonderful stay. The Airbnb is beautiful and clean and close to many wineries. Fantastic hosts. We will be back for sure.
Great location and space for two people. Super host.

In a word, perfect!
Quiet, peaceful, large enough for all our needs, small enough to be cozy and intimate! Close in for everything Walla Walla offers.
We enjoyed every moment! We will return!!

Quaint room in a perfect location. Clean, quiet and hosts are easy to communicate with.
Coffee available in the room is great!
Perfect location, very comfortable, quiet, and spotless!!! The owners are wonderful and very responsive to any questions. We will definitely be back!
Wonderful place for a comfy stay!

This was the perfect place for my husband and I to come for a weekend wedding. It was easy to find, very convenient to both drive and walk to many places, and the hosts were lovely. The room was cute and comfortable and had all the things we needed. Walla Walla is a great town and When we come back, we will definitely stay at this wonderful apartment.
Place was great! Scott checked on us made sure everything was good. Place was comfortable, great value, and everything you need! We would rent Scott’s place again.

The space is perfectly decorated and has many nice touches. Check in was very easy and they were flexible with us as we had to change our arrival time last minute. We had the best experience here! Our host was extremely kind, there when needed and gave us just the right amount of privacy. The space is as comfortable and cute as it looks, plenty of room for the two of us, and an amazing location right in town. No doubt we will be back again!

I loved staying in this lovely little cottage while visiting my daughter who is a student at Whitman. The space is small, but incredibly clean and well-stocked. I appreciated the privacy and yet felt taken care of by Marqui and Scott. I highly recommend this spot!
Their place was clean and beautiful! Very well located too :)

Scott’s place was exactly what I expected - small and quaint, great location, and just what we needed for our weekend stay in Walla Walla. He was great at communicating and checking with us. I would definitely stay here again!
Nice place! Quite small, suitable for a couple or friends who don't mind rooming together
Sweet and stylish little studio in quiet neighborhood. Super helpful hosts who helped me check in early and very responsive.
Great place and very friendly hosts! I highly recommend this place and will be back!
We had a great time here! Cute and perfect for a couple. Very comfortable bed and lots of amenities. We will definitely be back!

Scott and Marqui's place is exactly as advertised. It's cozy, private, and centrally located in Walla Walla, a nice 20-minute walk through Whitman College's campus to downtown. We'd happily stay there again.
Our third excellent stay here! Highly recommend to anyone looking for a great spot in Walla Walla.
Quaint cottage in a very nice neighborhood. Everything you need for a getaway in Walla Walla. Enjoyable walk into town thru the Whitman University Campus.
Sweet little spot in a great location! Walking distance to downtown wineries and shops. Quiet neighborhood, cozy space and secure location.
This rental is clean, comfortable, and adorable. We slept great! The shower is wonderful, the air-conditioner was pleasantly quiet, and the hosts were kind. We would definitely stay here again!!
A lovely little bungalow, with a great location close to the Whitman College campus and downtown Walla Walla.

Great location, great shower, comfy bed, super cozy space, has all you need for a couple nights as long as you plan on not cooking. Lovely studio with everything two people need. The hosts are wonderful. We will definitely return!

So cozy and comfortable, walking distance to downtown and the University.
Wonderful easy place to stay for our first trip to Walla Walla, hardest part is just deciding where to eat and go wine tasting.
My sister and I had a great stay. This was my 2nd stay at Scott’s and it’s still my favorite spot to spend the night. It’s tiny, but clean and cozy with so many amenities. I will be back for sure.
Awesome place. Host is great. Stay here.
Incredibly sweet spot, very conveniently located to explore the town and campus. We had a wonderful, relaxing time!

This is a perfect home away from home. The guest house is in a great location, first of all. We will happily stay here again!
Scott and Marqui’s darling cottage is THE place to stay in Walla Walla. The location is perfect. As others have noted, the bed and shower are A+. And the hospitality? A+++++!

Great hosts, location, and wineries. Need I say more?

This place is amazing!!! Checking in was super easy, place was super clean and oh so cute. Hosts were great…chatted with Marqui one afternoon like we were old friends, super fun to meet and chat with the hosts!! If we ever go back to Walla Walla this will be our place again!!! Thank you…
Look forward to our next stay. It was more than expected and location is fabulous!
Excellent location. Super clean studio, very quiet and lovely hosts.
Very clean and comfortable. Walla Wall is a wonderful town!!

Sweet spot in cozy, tree lined neighborhood. Served our purposes perfectly ie sleep and shower. We were there during the big western US heatwave (110+😳)…great AC! Beautiful country, food and of course, wine! We’re coming back!

This is one of the best AirBnB’s I’ve ever stayed in. Scott and family were very welcoming and quick to respond. Very clean, lovely backyard, and close to everything downtown. Easy 10 minute walk! I recommend this place for your walla walla vacation. Will definitely stay again when back in town.

We had such a perfect stay here!! It was a beautiful space, with everything we needed. Our hosts were responsive and kind, and made check in and out so easy.
The location was also excellent!
This is a great cozy retreat. I enjoyed talking with Scott and Marqui as I sat in their sunny yard. The cottage was comfortable, well appointed and sparkling clean.

A wonderfully quiet and cozy little spot in a convenient part of town. There was AC, a fan, and a beautiful cherry tree right outside the front door awaiting me on a hot June day. Communication was consistent and helpful. The shower was relaxing and I had two great nights of sleep. Would definitely stay here again.

The Stopover was the perfect place for us during our long weekend in Walla Walla! The location couldn’t be more perfect. The amenities were spot on from great temperature control, a beautiful shower/bathroom and comfortable bed. We hope to stay again next year!
the location was perfect to ride our bikes to town every day! we can't wait to come stay again.
